sentence.Network_en: The government largely misread the mood of the electorate.
sentence.Network_cn: 政府在很大程度上没有弄清楚全体选民的情绪。

sentence.Network_en: The Government could expect only ingratitude from the electorate.
sentence.Network_cn: 政府从选民那里得到的只有忘恩负义。

sentence.Network_en: Mr Walsh has a keen appreciation of the priorities of the electorate.
sentence.Network_cn: 沃尔什先生深刻理解选民最为关注的事项。

entry.def: The electorate of a country or area is all the people in it who have the right to vote in an election.

example.ex: He has the backing of almost a quarter of the electorate.
example.tran: 他得到了几乎1/4选民的支持。

means.word_mean: 1. the body of enfranchised citizens; those qualified to vote

auth_sentence.content: So how will this play with the French electorate?
auth_sentence.res_content: So how will this play with the French electorate?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: So how will this play with the French electorate?

auth_sentence.content: The recall electorate was skewed demographically towards the Republicans.
auth_sentence.res_content: The recall electorate was skewed demographically towards the Republicans.

auth_sentence.content: The early voters' views reflect the overall electorate's.
